intro: Smyrnium americanum, commonly known as American cowbane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in wetlands and along stream banks. It produces small, dry fruits that contain toxic seeds, making it potentially harmful to livestock and humans. Due to its toxicity, it is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
